main event: A highly maneuverable metallic object was observed over Nashua, Montana on September 13, 1960.
interesting points: The object was tracked by ground radar and visually observed for approximately 15 minutes., It was described as circular with a glow around the outer edge., The sighting took place under clear weather conditions with calm winds., Witness Thomas Smith was the Director of Security for a telephone company., Multiple military personnel corroborated the sighting with steady observations.
sighted object: one highly maneuverable metallic circular object
witness description: Thomas Smith, Director of Security, telephone company
